subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Boo Weekley and Heath Slocum of the United States combined for an 11-under-par 61 in best-ball play to take a one-stroke lead over Alex Cejka and Martin Kaymer of Germany at the World Cup of Golf in Shenzhen, China. Finland, Wales, Scotland, South Africa, Thailand and England were two shots back.Weekley, No. 43 in the world, had six birdies and an eagle. He was picked to represent the United States after 13 other higher-ranked Americans turned down the invitation. He picked the 70th-ranked Slocum, his friend from high school in Florida.“I think I was up in a tree deer hunting when I got the call,” Weekley said.The teams will play an alternate-shot round today, another best-ball round tomorrow and then close with alternate shot Sunday.
